name: Tamika Ruffin
text: BEWARE: We closed on July 8, 2020. We had just moved to AL from NC. We had no family here. And the timing was in the middle of COVID-19 when no childcare is available. We had to bring our four children with us. We decided to split up to watch the kids. My husband went in first. I went in second. When my husband came out alone, I handed him the keys to take the kids in our vehicle. I went into the office with Christopher to sign. He showed me the plot map and told me where to sign. I made the assumption since I was signing paperwork that it was accurate as it was based on our closing disclosure. Right on line 17, it says I was to be on the title. When we received our warranty deed in the mail this last friday, we called the attorney's office for the second time. The first time we called we spoke to Anna who told us she was going to get me added to the deed and it would be corrected. That was when I purchased the deed from the county a couple of weeks ago. She assured us it would be corrected. Therefore, when we received another one in the mail on Friday, we assumed it was the correct one. However, it was not. So we called ALS again. We talked to Shannon this time and was told I could not be on the loan because I was not on the sales contract. We had done this exact thing before in NC so that was strange. I asked for the law statue. Shannon said she did not know what it was. I said ok. I reached out to Veterans United because our closing disclosure from them said I was supposed to be on the deed. Mr. Morgan asked if I could call our closing agent back to see who he contacted from Veterans United who denied adding me to the loan as he stated because that was not their policy as they did it for us in NCs. I followed up with our closing agent Christopher with ALS to get the answers for Mr. Morgan. I was told by Christopher that he doesn't remember who or when he contacted Veterans United. I said so I am just taking your word for it? He said well I have the survivorship deed you can sign. I said I understand that. However, you said you reached out to Veterans United and they denied your request of adding me to the loan. He said well you sat at closing and just signed instead of asking questions. I said you are right because I trusted your office. In the midst of a pandemic, we are moving across country with four small children and no family. Our children were anxious as we had just drove 4 hours to get to his closing office that morning at 10am. I was never able to get the truth about the situation. Christopher with ALS was very unprofessional and lacked empathy for this mistake. I said I was going to write a review about our experience since he basically told us it was our fault for not reading what we signed. PLEASE DO NOT ASSUME THAT WHAT IS ON YOUR CLOSING DISCLOSURE IS WHAT YOU ARE SIGNING IN HIS OFFICE. Oh and he said he was going to tear up the survivorship deed we were supposed to pickup in the morning. Our realtor, Scott Smart, picked him and had never heard of this law before. I regret not looking at the reviews first. Christopher also threatened to have his attorney sent me a letter for writing an honest review of our experience. Can we really trust the good reviews?? Also, he mentioned us having all them kids at closing so he is remembered that when it had 45 days ago, but conveniently, he COULD NOT REMEMBER WHO OR WHEN HE CALLED VETERANS UNITED. He could NOT remember whether he explained to me what I was signing or not, either. PLEASE BE CAREFUL.

name: Shannon Ball
text:
Notice all good reviews are from employees?!  Hmmm

Recruiter reached out and kept having to reschedule the call. Then after stating I’d be a great fit for this database administrator and mentioning other roles, even discussing salary - he went radio silent, for weeks now.

Leading people on is very cruel and extremely unprofessional.  Says a lot about the company as a whole. You’re dealing with people’s lives here! I’m glad I didn’t get the job after seeing how they treat candidates.

name: Caitlin B
text:
Notice all of the 5 star reviews are from company employees...

I have been on the same medication for 10+ years with no issues from my prior insurance company. After calling numerous times, spending hours on the phone, and getting a different answer from each rep, I was informed that my request was denied. Not because I didn’t have the correct diagnosis but because they are demanding I try a list of generic medications first. AKA they are too cheap to pay for my prescription. They do not care about withholding medication from you, they are just looking to save $$ wherever possible. STAY AWAY FROM RXBENEFITS.

name: Nathaniel Shaw
text: Most complicated benefits/insurance company I have ever dealt with. I've dealth with 3 insurance companies through 3 different employers over the last 10 years. Favorite line for anyone in customer service is "We are not set up for that." Gives me the feeling that RxBenefits is not set up to effectively conduct business the way the rest of their industry is. If you have any say so in the situation, avoid RxBenefits. Our company insurance is by far the best insurance I've ever had, their achilles heel is RxBenefits.

name: Sydney Stein
text:
I just hit my one year with RxBenefits as my employer and I cannot express the gratitude I have for working at such an amazing company. They truly care about their employees because they take action to prove they care.

I am fortunate enough to work remotely, which allows me the flexibility to maintain a busy lifestyle. RxBenefits has never made me feel separate being remote because the community within our company really comes together to make everyone feel welcome. When I visit the corporate office, I feel right at home with my peers and management, it's as if I never left from my previous visit.

If taking care of their employees wasn't enough, they also take tremendous care of their clients and members, making sure customer service is top notch, as well as making sure that everything they need is provided.

name: Kelly Franklin
text:
Two years ago I quite my at a fortune 100 company so that I could come work at RxBenefits.  It was the best decision I could have made.  They care deeply about their employees and show that through many different ways.  Whether it is through amazing health insurance benefits, fun competitions or giving us off on Black Friday every year so we can go shopping and spend time with our families!

RxBenefits not only cares about their employees, they care about their clients and members as well.  They do whatever they can to please the clients and members.  They strive to be the best and it shows!

name: Grant Farr
text:
Our company recently switched to RxBenefits as the company that "dispenses" our pharmacy benefits. Like others, notice how all the 5 star reviews are from employees, which is great, I cannot say that anytime calling customer service they were not "kind". However, I can say for sure that I have experienced what a LOT of others have, which is that I was taking a medication for 20 years, that is GENERIC, and they would not cover once the benefits implementation was switched to these folks. The first prior authorization was DENIED incredibly despite my doctor saying it "doesn't seem wise or prudent" to have to rapidly stop the medication.

I am really blessed, so I could afford to pay out of pocket to fight with the company for 6 months, using coupons etc. while I got "approval" on a second prior auth. Again, I am blessed to have some medical knowledge, reasonable time, and afford to find other resources to pay. However, I KNOW FOR SURE that a lot of folks don't, and that this could have been catastrophic (I.e. couldn't get right meds - more PCP or heaven forbid ED visits which then just waste time at PCP/etc offices). This company advertises how "great a workplace" they are and they are "saving money" for companies, but all of these review are pretty clear HOW they are doing that. Putting up arbitrary guidelines that just waste your doctors time, your companies HR time, and frankly, the patient's time as well. Please, this company is TERRIBLE. I will be preaching against them to ANY HR meeting I'm in and will NEVER use this company again.

These tools have been a huge boon to MSFC and are currently being looked at by the entire NASA Agency for Agency-wide deployment! I highly recommend Mission Multiplier!

text: VERY NICE PEOPLE AND  BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENT 👍👍👍

name: Joey Syron
text:
We at John G Walton have worked and completed numerous projects throughout Mobile County with Driven Engineering overseeing the design, implementation and installation. We as a company currently have projects on the books with Avalisha and Driven and look forward to getting them started and complete. Driven does some of the best plans in the county, they have engineering technology in building models that is years away from other companies.

If your in need of a design firm, this is definitely the company your searching for.

name: Bama Junky
text: Driven has provided excellent service for my department over the past 4 years.  The staff is very knowledgeable and professional.

name: Rx Burner
text: We have worked with this firm for about 6 years (design work, surveys, & dam inspections) and have been very pleased with their work. They are very responsive and great to get along with.

name: Allen Rentz
text: Avilisha and her firm has been professional from day one.  They are reliable and very knowledgeable.  Great family feel and friendly staff.

name: Randy Spear
text: Utilized Avalisha Fisher's expertise in litigation as an expert witness. Her vast experience and knowledge of both applicable building codes and sound engineering practices yielded tremendous results. Highly recommend Driven Engineering.

name: James Shivers
text: Super nice guy, excellent service, and very knowledgeable.  Kent walked me around during the home inspection and showed me exactly what he was looking for and why it was important, for a first time home buyer that was very beneficial.  Full report was provided to me the very next day with everything we went over. Very pleasant experience.

name: Minela Rivera
text: Kent is super nice, knowledgeable, works quickly and thoroughly and is competitive with pricing. I would definitely recommend!

text: I'd rate 10 stars if I could. Michael is the best.

text: Excellent Law Firm, they do great work and don't overcharge their clients
